title: this game is going to crumble soon
body:
my pre level 30 experience so far 

-Try hards who decline surrender votes in a game with an afk and calling people  failures for not doing so 
-Keyboard warriors telling people to kill themselves and flaming people  along with ping spams 
-intentionally afking and feeding 
-people who were feeding all game then talking trash when they win 

nobody is new to the game, the only people playing are the people who got perma banned and playing on a new smurf.

replies.body:
I never surrender. People throw; give your opponents the opportunity to do so.

{{champion:51}}

Eh, you can find those same issues anywhere on the internet with nearly any game.  League is a group based game with very little solo content that is actually fulfilling.

It doesn't get any better at the higher ranks, and I think it's kind of... false to attribute your experience as there not being new players.  The game is VERY good and recognizing new accounts for experienced players.
So you just describe children in online gaming in general
i have only been playing for what a year im considered new lol

Crumbling soon?

This Season is the most enjoyable time i ever had in LoL. It has good visuals, Cool Champ Designs, a meaningful Honor System, good Punishment system (Except for Inting, that has a long way to go), it gets regular updates on old Champs, which modernizes them, without changing the price (hello Warwick Poppy and the upcoming Ryze Rework).
We get a "Warded"-Ping, we have SoloQ aswell as FlexQ and 3v3 Rankeds, the Dia V-Plat I is more or less fixed, i know a lot of people that started LoL not a long time ago, so it is still a fresh game that welcomes casuals extremly well, Riot is listening to our complains so often, killing our Memes. Runesystem gets reworked, so all the people i play with get their Ip refunded and can purchase Champs.

Like, holy shit, LoL does has flaws, but heck, im spamming LoL so much right now and i enjoy it to the fullest atm. I think this Season is the best Season to start the game, with all the ressources of learning we have and the way the game is played. I cant imagine it dying out in the near future, as long as we dont have an Apocalypse or giant World War or anything like that.
